subject: ant junit performance problem
msgSnippet: A full run of our test suite using ant takes about 4 minutes using fork= true . The same test suite run in Intelilj IDEA takes less than a minute. I figured
messageBody:
A full run of our test suite using ant takes about 4 minutes using
fork="true". The same test suite run in Intelilj IDEA takes less than
a minute. I figured this was because I had fork="true" on the junit
task, so I changed it to fork="false". The test execution got
marginally slower, and eventually I got an OutOfMemoryError.

Clearly the ant junit task is doing something radically different
than what happens within the context of IDEA. (The fast same-JVM
execution also occurs when using eclipse.) Has anyone else
experienced this? Any clues as to what might be going on?

I'm using JDK 1.4.2_02 on Windows XP.

Thanks,
Dan
